docs.lead_paragraph: ''I miss the cookies and the fries,'' Max Gold-Landzberg said. Sitting in the cafeteria at John Jay High School in Cross River, N.Y., Max, 17, a senior, chomped on a roast beef and cheese sandwich on a whole wheat roll.
docs.abstract: Article on changes to public school menus across New York metropolitan region as districts begin to comply with new federal law requiring them to develop 'wellness policies' outlining nutrition and exercise goals before classes began this fall; local school boards vary enormously in how they are interpreting federal mandate, with some making significant changes and others doing almost nothing; photos (L)
docs.snippet: ''I miss the cookies and the fries,'' Max Gold-Landzberg said.      Sitting in the cafeteria at John Jay High School in Cross River, N.Y., Max, 17, a senior, chomped on a roast beef and cheese sandwich on a whole wheat roll.
